body: Hi I only can speak for the messages.js, no need to translate those, we will drop the multi language support in the next gen of the jsf.js, from then onwards only english messages will be shown coming out of the framework (not that the end user ever sees those). But that is just the javascript part, cannot comment on the rest.
src/test can just be ignored, it's really only for the unittests
any news? :)

Hi,

I added all other messages files that we updated (used in our project);
- `Messages.properties`: removed few trailing spaces
- `Messages_en.properties`: same as above
- `Messages_de.properties`: fixed character encodings, spaces
- `Messages_es.properties`: encodings, updated order (to compare with base more easily), added missing variables (like `{2}: ` prefixes)
- `Messages_it.properties`: like above
- `Messages_pt.properties`: copied from `Messages_pt_BR.properties`, updated like above

Will it be useful to merge? If not, I will revert and only finish Ukrainian translation.

Yep of course
I really wonder why we have wrong encoding and nobody mentioned it over the years

What to do with Portuguese and Brazilian Portuguese?

We do not separate these languages, and therefore we renamed `Messages_pt_BR.properties` to `Messages_pt.properties` and updated the last one.

In this repository, I created a new file, but does it makes sense to keep two files identical (right now Messages_pt.properties is slightly better, but as we didn't change any sentences it can be backported)? Should I rename `Messages_pt_BR.properties` to `Messages_pt.properties` in the PR?
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MYFACES-4331

Where does `org.apache.myfaces.renderkit.html.HtmlMessagesRenderer.IN_FIELD` message used? There is only one word and it is untranslated in many languages, should I keep it as is?

```
org.apache.myfaces.renderkit.html.HtmlMessagesRenderer.IN_FIELD = \u0020in {0}
```
* `\u0020` is a space character

i think it's unused (IN_FIELD)
we should remove it in master at least

about pt pt_BR:
i think we should leave it as it is in older branches and rename it in master

Created additional merge requests for `master` and `3.0.x` branches.
- In master, I renamed `pt_BR` to `pt`. In other branches added additionally.
- I didn't remove any fields anywhere

You added the new file Messages_uk.properties -  it contains only escaped chars, i assume this is correct? (never checked the ukraine language, so no idea :))

Another question is e.g.:
javax.faces.validator.RegexValidator.NOT_MATCHED = {1}: Validation Error: Value not according to pattern ''{0}''

is it correct hat {0} is surrounded by double '?

> You added the new file Messages_uk.properties - it contains only escaped chars, I assume this is correct? (never checked the Ukraine language, so no idea :))

Unfortunately, we still use the Cyrillic alphabet and all characters our of ASCII range. Similar to Chinese, Arabic...

> Another question is e.g.:
javax.faces.validator.RegexValidator.NOT_MATCHED = {1}: Validation Error: Value not according to pattern ''{0}''
> is it correct hat {0} is surrounded by double '?

I don't know, they wrapped into double '' in the source file (messages.properties).

ok i see, will merge it for now
thank you for your great contribution!
@astappiev could you please check my latest commit? I removed the IN_FIELD message via my IDE and it only showed those removal changes. However github shows some encoding changes....

All fine, your IDE replaced upper case letters with lower case for native-encoded characters.
\+ Fixed encoding for all other languages.

Thanks for the PR!
everything else is now aligned with the quarkus naming conventions? (like directory structure?)

The directories look ok, but you need to add a `quarkus-extension.yaml` in the runtime module: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/extensions/resteasy-qute/runtime/src/main/resources/META-INF/quarkus-extension.yaml
Thanks, i will add one

@gastaldi i wonder how it should work

should a user only add the quarkus-myfaces dependency or also the quarkus-myfaces-deployment?
in your tutorials, you only add the runtime module (https://quarkus.io/guides/qute)
how is the deployment module important in "showcase" then?
The deployment module is transparently (or magically? :) )  resolved by the quarkus plugin, in the showcase you must ONLY depend on the runtime module.
Will this also work in our case for external quarkus extensions?

ok NVM - recompiled everything and works now

but removing the deployment-module from showcase doesnt work
so i think the quarkus plugin doesn't resolve external extensions
@aloubyansky could you confirm that https://github.com/apache/myfaces/pull/98#issuecomment-617784281 is an issue?

I guess it's because the quarkus maven plugin isn't properly configured for the runtime artifact. @tandraschko have you followed https://quarkus.io/guides/writing-extensions#maven-setup ? You should see `META-INF/quarkus-extension.properties` in the runtime JAR. Users should never add the deployment deps to their apps.

ahh i see
works now, thanks :)

thanks for the PR!
I just wonder why we need common-lang now. Did quarkus add this dependency?
About the commons lang, probably it was being brought by another dependency transitively before because after rebasing my branch with master I started getting compilation error,

Also note that native mode is only working on Linux with GraalVM 19.3.1. Before it was also working on MacOS and with Graal 20 because we didn't needed the substitutions to disable MethodHandles.

I think the MacOS and Graal 20 issues I had will be fixed in upcoming versions of GraalVM
Is optional preffered over scope provided?
Nice job getting the annotation working.  IMO `<scope>provided</scope>` would make more sense for this, but there must be some historical reason that this file only uses `<optional>true</optional>`?

@tandraschko @wtlucy  yes I just kept consistent with what was already in the pom as well as following the instructions for the plugin: https://www.mojohaus.org/animal-sniffer/animal-sniffer-annotations/
I'll merge this tomorrow if there are no other concerns. Thanks for the reviews!
works now without commons-fileupload
cant merge it as "All checks have failed" but i applied the changes

AFAIR i fixed such a casting exception in the past, support passivating and non-passivating in the abstractcontext. Can you check this? ViewScoped should have the same problem and works fine.

NOTE: we already need a JIRA ticket for tracking purpose

Regarding `@ViewScoped`:

https://github.com/apache/myfaces/blob/02632b043881dac9de46a48ebd8319c1f3255df9/impl/src/main/java/org/apache/myfaces/cdi/view/ViewScopeContextualStorage.java#L111

`@ViewScoped` has an explicit `instanceof` check, which is another way of fixing the same problem.

OK
Would be great you can fix it Like viewscoped

Sure!  That was actually the first thing I did in my local copy and it worked fine, I just thought itd be preferable to make a more conservative change instead given my unfamiliarity with the code base. :)  Ill update the PR later.
Updated.
Thanks!
Looks ok
Looks good!
if you merge it, dont forget to merge in 3.0
@tandraschko thanks, will do - I'll finish this up this week
Thanks for the PR
I'll port this to the other branches now
Hmm. [website](https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/myfaces/site/publish/core30/index.html) is still using the old styling.
Cancelling.
I can see this NS change here: https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/mojarra/commit/c3b0dc5fcbdc2eca83239d9b2881f19a0e0cbc10
Maybe you can also check the Mojarra sources of the RC5 branch

Please careful when checking other source  
https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html#weak-copyleft-licenses
Thanks!

@tandraschko 

Firstly, I apologize for the  delay on this, but I finally spent  some time on this and here's what I found -- 

-  I don't really see anything within MyFaces that  matches the Namespace changes done in Mojarra. 
     - No hits for [NamespaceContext](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/javax/xml/namespace/NamespaceContext.html?is-external=true) in MyFaces. 

- There doesn't appear to be any Namespace handing within the MyFaces implementation. The only thing that  matters from the faces-config declaration is the [version](https://github.com/apache/myfaces/blob/3.0.x/impl/src/main/java/org/apache/myfaces/config/impl/digester/DigesterFacesConfigUnmarshallerImpl.java#L55)?  I didn't experience any errors or warnings when just using **< faces-config version="3.0" >**.

The code for handling the faces-config isn't very straightforward, but I saw that the parsing is accomplished  by [DigesterFacesConfigUnmarshallerImpl](https://github.com/apache/myfaces/blob/3.0.x/impl/src/main/java/org/apache/myfaces/config/impl/digester/DigesterFacesConfigUnmarshallerImpl.java#L512) which is called from  [here](https://github.com/apache/myfaces/blob/3.0.x/impl/src/main/java/org/apache/myfaces/config/DefaultFacesConfigurationProvider.java#L437). 

Should I first  implement something relating to the NamespaceContext, but I'm not sure if it's necessary?

Last of all, I also don't think this PR needs the impl/src/main/conf/META-INF/standard-faces-config-base.xml change?

Dont know, to be honest.
I dont think we need such a NamespaceContext if a faces-config with https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee namespace can be parsed by MF.

+1 if you added some tests for it

please also add it to master, which is now Jakarta Faces 4.0

Added tested :) 
Please let me know if you have issues issues with the version handling updates as well. (I can make it in a separate change instead)

+1, looks
please also port it to master/4.0
i also refactored the version handling there and defaulted to 4.0 isntead 1.2

also close the issue then plz :)
Looks good, thanks!
+1 both PRs looks ok for me

@volosied please merge this to 4.0/master and close the issue;

EDIT: you already did, sry! i will resolve the JIRA issue then.
lets close this for now in favor of docs / leo suggestion

+1 for both

Sure, done. I also realized that `StateCacheClientSide` needed to be updated.
Please create a Ticket for Tracking and also apply it for 4.0

I would go with this for now
Also please add a unittest and also merge it to master
Sounds good. I'll keep the other PR open for later, but go with this one for the 3.0.0 release. Thanks!
+1 for this PR, to continue supporting old schema versions

I'm not sure of a way to add a Unit Test. 

Current stack trace shows --
```
Jan 15, 2021 12:04:51 PM org.apache.myfaces.config.ConfigFilesXmlValidationUtils$ValidationErrorHandler error
SEVERE: cvc-enumeration-valid: Value '3.0' is not facet-valid with respect to enumeration '[1.2, 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3]'. It must be a value from the enumeration.
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; lineNumber: 23; columnNumber: 17; cvc-enumeration-valid: Value '3.0' is not facet-valid with respect to enumeration '[1.2, 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3]'. It must be a value from the enumeration.
	at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.util.ErrorHandlerWrapper.createSAXParseException(ErrorHandlerWrapper.java:204)
	....
	at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(XML11Configuration.java:824)
	at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.validation.StreamValidatorHelper.validate(StreamValidatorHelper.java:176)
	at java.xml/com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.jaxp.validation.ValidatorImpl.validate(ValidatorImpl.java:115)
	at java.xml/javax.xml.validation.Validator.validate(Validator.java:124)
	at org.apache.myfaces.config.ConfigFilesXmlValidationUtils.validateFacesConfigFile(ConfigFilesXmlValidationUtils.java:248)
	at org.apache.myfaces.config.ConfigFilesXmlValidationUtilsTestCase.testJSF30Config(ConfigFilesXmlValidationUtilsTestCase.java:84)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
.....
```

I was thinking that the `testJSF30Config` should throw an exception, but that doesn't actually occur. 

The error handle just logs the exception instead of re-throwing the exception as in the [fatalError method. ](https://github.com/apache/myfaces/blob/084d3c8d7c21e4c964c1a13b430563bc4bfb7aed/impl/src/main/java/org/apache/myfaces/config/ConfigFilesXmlValidationUtils.java#L226-L228)

https://github.com/apache/myfaces/blob/084d3c8d7c21e4c964c1a13b430563bc4bfb7aed/impl/src/main/java/org/apache/myfaces/config/ConfigFilesXmlValidationUtils.java#L231-L236

Not sure if error handing should changed or not?
When I did the earlier PRs I hadn't thought that we needed to update the websocket token as part of myfaces-4373, but we might as well. +1
closing in favor of #144
please also add 2.3-next here, thats the only version currently usable by Quarkus users and its the same codebase as 4.0

+1 if well tested, code looks fine

please also add it to 2.3-next, thats the only version currently usable by Quarkus users and its the same codebase as 4.0
It's based on this https://github.com/apache/myfaces/security/code-scanning
also dont forget the homepage

@tandraschko 

Is 2.3-next just a improved replacement for 2.3.x? If yes then I shouldn't apply the change to AES for 2.3-next

somehow yes, in general its a completely cleaned-up 2.3, which i created as preperation for 4.0.
Currently 4.0 equals 2.3-next, but with jakarta namespace and @ClientWindowScoped prototype.

Im also ok to not merge it, we should just decide how we maintain 2.3-next.
Could this break something?

adding 

`setFeature( "http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl", true ); 
`

would break.

The rest is from here https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html

I checked other apache projects many of them doing the same
@volosied should I apply this to 3.0.x as well?
then +1
If we do it for 3.0, then please apply it for 23next too

Sorry I didn't see your comment from the master PR. 

From what I read, we definitely should upgrade DES.  

As for HmacSHA256, I don't see any harm in updating. I  found some articles about collisions with SHA1, and SHA256 seems to be generally more preferred.   I'm curious about performance, but users of MyFaces always have the option to change these algorithms if they so choose.   

+1 from me.

Can we exclude the linux-ppc64le build as well? 
Hmm as far I can see we should only use the github action for pull requests. We are still waiting for the travis build

I can try to remove  linux-ppc64le, too.

Queued, but not started... Let me investigate.
Sorry, testing in master since builds aren't running in 3.0.x. Appears to be a seperate issue.
Hmm... Maybe I'm going about it wrong? https://travis-ci.community/t/if-doesnt-appear-to-work-in-exclude/8595/7
One thing I think need to update is the cron email notifications. Did you receive any today?
Where is the travis email notification configured?

I don't see a way to modify notification for cron jobs. 

Only notifications I see are under https://travis-ci.com/account/preferences

 ```
Build emails
The status of your builds straight to your inbox
``` 

However, I think we can have Travis  email our myfaces listserv if you'd like (preferably on failures) by setting it in the yaml file.
It's fine for now. But I think we should use https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/MyFaces/ instead of Travis

Tobago is using a pipline

https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/MyFaces/job/Tobago%20pipeline/
